lines.text: Flourish. Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, AGRIPPA, with DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, and others

lines.speaker: octavius caesar
lines.text: Go forth, Agrippa, and begin the fight: Our will is Antony be took alive Make it so known.

lines.speaker: octavius caesar
lines.text: The time of universal peace is near: Prove this a prosperous day, the threenookd world Shall bear the olive freely.

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Antony Is come into the field.

lines.speaker: octavius caesar
lines.text: Go charge Agrippa Plant those that have revolted in the van, That Antony may seem to spend his fury Upon himself.

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: Alexas did revolt and went to Jewry on Affairs of Antony there did persuade Great Herod to incline himself to Caesar, And leave his master Antony: for this pains Caesar hath hangd him. Canidius and the rest That fell away have entertainment, but No honourable trust. I have done ill Of which I do accuse myself so sorely, That I will joy no more.

lines.speaker: soldier
lines.text: Enobarbus, Antony Hath after thee sent all thy treasure, with His bounty overplus: the messenger Came on my guard and at thy tent is now Unloading of his mules.

lines.speaker: soldier
lines.text: Mock not, Enobarbus. I tell you true: best you safed the bringer Out of the host I must attend mine office, Or would have donet myself. Your emperor Continues still a Jove.

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: I am alone the villain of the earth, And feel I am so most. O Antony, Thou mine of bounty, how wouldst thou have paid My better service, when my turpitude Thou dost so crown with gold! This blows my heart: If swift thought break it not, a swifter mean Shall outstrike thought: but thought will dot, I feel. I fight against thee! No: I will go seek Some ditch wherein to die the foulst best fits My latter part of life.
